ResourceHeader.Description: ESA's Planetary Science Archive (PSA) is the central repository for all scientific and engineering data returned by ESA's Solar System missions: as of June, 2012, Giotto, Huygens, Mars Express, Rosetta, SMART-1, and Venus Express, as well as several ground-based cometary observations. The PSA uses NASA's Planetary Data System standards as a baseline for the formatting and structure of all data within the archive. PSA is located at the European Space Astronomy Center near Madrid, Spain.
